thread.title: Storms, more dangerous heat expected in central Pa. on Friday, weekend - pennlive.com
thread.title_full: Storms, more dangerous heat expected in central Pa. on Friday, weekend - pennlive.com

author: Janet Pickel
title: Storms, more dangerous heat expected in central Pa. on Friday, weekend - pennlive.com
text:
After a hot and mostly dry July , central Pennsylvania is starting August with rain — and still more high temperatures.
Some parts of the Harrisburg area saw short downpours Thursday , and similar heavy rain could hit Friday.
More : Statewide weather alerts The forecast from the National Weather Service calls for a chance of showers and thunderstorms today. Accuweather says the greatest chance for rain is around 10 a.m., then again after 5 p.m.
The high temperature will be around 91, but it’ll feel like 100-104 degrees. That’s prompted a heat advisory that’s in effect until 8 tonight in a region that includes Franklin, Perry, Dauphin, Lebanon, Cumberland, Adams, York and Lancaster counties.
The weather service warns that the heat could lead to illnesses in some people; knowing the difference between life-threatening heat stroke and heat exhaustion can help save lives.
Live radar over Pennsylvania :
Rain and more thunderstorms are possible on Saturday , but less likely on Sunday. Both days will have high temperatures in the upper 80s to low 90s, and Monday will be even hotter.
Here’s the forecast for the next few days:
Today: Rain, storms. High 90, low 74 Saturday: Partly sunny, thunderstorms. High 88, low 72 Sunday: Chance of storms. High 89, low 70. Monday: Mostly cloudy. High 98, low 70.
